intro: Tribulus rajasthanensis, commonly known as the Rajasthan Tribulus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Rajasthan, India. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Its leaves are usually small and opposite, while its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds. Due to its unique ecological role, it is considered an important species for desert flora.
